content: basic witch beanie a witching hour knits design years back i knit myself a fingering weight 1x1 ribbed double thick beanie the entire intention of it was to mimic as closely as possible those always cozy cheap basic beanies you can find at a gas station or carhartt store if you re feeling fancy knit from the top down and then decreased at the other end this hat is then folded inside itself for maximum warmth when you need it notes at the bottom though will tell you how to modify it if you only want a single layer materials - approx 450 yds of fingering weight yarn - us 3 needles or size needed to obtain gauge double pointed and 16 inch circular - stitch markers - tapestry needle for weaving in ends gauge 6 sts per inch in 1x1 rib slightly stretched on us 3 needle or size needed for gauge pattern abbreviations and techniques - k knit - p purl - st s stitch es - m1 make one stitch - k2tog knit two stitches together - ssk slip slip knit - p2tog purl two sts together - ssp slip slip purl - m marker - pm place marker - sm slip marker instructions before starting note that the tail from casting on and any yarn ends along the way should be woven in on the work before decreasing is begun because the hat is closed at both ends there isn t an easy way to work them in afterwards cast on 8 sts and divide over 3 needles join in the round and work k1p1 for one round on next round m1 after every stitch maintaining knits and purls as established in first round on next round place markers as follows in preparation for continued increasing k1 pm k1 p1 k1 pm k1 pm k1 p1 k1 pm k1 pm k1 p1 k1 pm k1 pm k1 p1 k1 increasing work the following 4 rounds until at 136 sts when needed switch to a circular needle and place a marker to indicate the beginning of round round 1 *k1 sm m1 p wise work sts in pattern to next marker m1 p wise sm* repeat from * to * 3 more times ending without a final marker to slip round 2 work knits and purls as established round 3 *k1 sm m1 k wise work sts in pattern to next marker m1 l wise sm* repeat from * to * 3 more times ending without a final marker to slip round 4 work knits and purls as established when increasing is done remove all markers except beginning of round marker and work in k1 p1 ribbing until piece measures 18 - 22 inches from the base of the increase section on last round place markers every 34 sts around decreasing work the following 4 rounds until 16 sts remain ending after round 1 when needed switch to double pointed needles round 1 *k1 k2tog work sts
